LineFollowerSim

Class LFS

  • java.lang.Object
    • LineFollowerSim.LFS

  • public class LFS
extends java.lang.Object
    LFS Class is Line Follower Simulator main class that handles:
    • tracking the position and heading of a virtual robot based on user specified target speed and turn rate
    • generating the view of the robots immediate surroundings
    • reading sensor values from user defined spot and line sensors
    • presentation of an image of the course with cookie crumb trail tracking progress of robot
    • calling user controller with sensor data made available at each simulation time step (where user updates robot target turn rate and speed).

    Author:
    Ron Grant

      • LFS

        public LFS(processing.core.PApplet parent)
        Parameters:
        parent - reference to processing applet (PApplet) creating instance of LFS. "this" specified by caller One instance should be created of LFS in your program. For example in setup() method include the line:

        lfs = new LFS(this);

      • defineRobotViewport

        public void defineRobotViewport(int x,
                                int y,
                                int width,
                                int height)
        Define robot view display region in screen coordinates. This viewport is scaled version of 64 DPI frame buffer rendered for robot sensor pixel sampling.

        TBD - might be requirement that aspect ratio is maintained. Might consider only width parameter with auto calculation of height if this is the case. - RDG Sept 19, 2020.

        Parameters:
        x - upper left corner x
        y - upper left corner y
        width - viewport width
        height - viewport height

      • updateSensors

        public void updateSensors(int r,
                          int g,
                          int b,
                          int a)
        Draw internal bitmap of robot proximity and update sensor data values. Called from draw() at each simulation step.

      • clearSensors

        public void clearSensors()
        Clear both spot and line sensor lists. Generally speaking this operation would not be required, but is performed before robot is reset and run. Where sensor definitions are re-instated via call to userInit() which sould contain sensor initialization code.

      • drawRobotAndCourseViews

        public void drawRobotAndCourseViews(int rvDiv,
                                    int cvDiv)
        Draw robot view and course views to screen. Divider variable 0=disable view, 1= draw every frame, 2 = every other frame (every two draw() calls), 3 every third frame (draw() call)... This allows throttling view updates which may be helpful if graphics perfomance is limited. The robot view is always rendered to an internal bitmap at fixed 64 DPI resolution to be available for spot and line sensor sample acquisition for each simulation time step. If either "div" value is greater than one this will be temporarily overridden whenever either mouse button is pressed to facilitate better animation of robot drag or rotation, especially if either value is set to large number e.g. (2,30) where course view is being updated very infrequently.
        Parameters:
        rvDiv - Robot view divider 0=disable 1=every draw() 2=every two draw() calls, 3=...
        cvDiv - Course view divider 0=disable 1=every draw() 2=every two draw() calls, 3=...

      • setAccRate

        public void setAccRate(float acc)
        Specify robot acceleration rate in inches/sec^2 units. Used when new target speed is greater than current speed. That is, per simulation timestep (dt) speed = speed + acc * dt, where speed is in inches/sec units.
        Parameters:
        acc - acceleration rate

      • setDecelRate

        public void setDecelRate(float dcel)
        Specify robot deceleration rate in inches/sec^2 units. Used when new target speed is less than current speed. That is, per simulation timestep (dt) speed = speed - dcel * dt, where speed is in inches/sec units.
        Parameters:
        dcel - deceleration rate

      • setTurnAcc

        public void setTurnAcc(float turnAcc)
        Specify robot turn rate acceleration and deceleration rates in degrees/sec^2 units used when new target turn rate is less or greater than current turn rate. For example, new turnRate greater than current turRate, per simulation time step (dt), turnRate = turRate + turnAcc*dt Likewise if new turnRate is less than current, turnRate = turnRate-turnAcc*dt. In each case overshoot or undershoot of targetTurnRate is corrected such that turnRate equals targetTurnRate.
        Parameters:
        turnAcc - turn acceleration/deceleration rate in degrees/sec^2 Note: unlike drive speed, turn acceleration and deceleration is symmetrical (equal values).

      • setMaxSpeed

        public void setMaxSpeed(float m)
        Inform LFS of your maximum robot drive speed (inches/sec). If simulation limits are exceeded, a warning message is generated and the value is limited to simulator maximum. Note driving and turning must take into consideration maxim turn rate and maximum drive speed where robot turning model assumes, differential drive robot with turn about center line applying uniform increase of speed of one wheel and decrease in speed of other wheel to effect turn.
        Parameters:
        m - maximum speed

      • getMaxSpeed

        public float getMaxSpeed()
        Get maximum robot speed as defined by simulator or a lesser speed as set by call to setMaxSpeed.
        Returns:
        maximum speed (inches/sec)

      • setMaxTurnRate

        public void setMaxTurnRate(float mt)
        Set maximum robot turn rate (degrees/sec) limited by LFS maximum value. If the maximum is exceeded, a warning message is generated and the stored value is set to the simulator maximum.
        Parameters:
        mt - maximum turn rate

      • getMaxTurnRate

        public float getMaxTurnRate()

      • changeSpeed

        public void changeSpeed(float delta)
        Change speed with no reported error checking, speed is restricted to maxSpeed. Generally setTargetSpeed() method is thought to be more useful for user robot controller.
        Parameters:
        delta - is change (inches/sec)

      • changeTurnRate

        public void changeTurnRate(float delta)
        Change turn rate (deg/sec) with no reported error checking, turn rate is restricted to maxTurnRate. Generally setTargetTurnRate() method is thought to be more useful for user robot controller.
        Parameters:
        delta - is change in (degrees/sec)

      • stop

        public void stop()
        robot is slowed to stop using pre-set decelRate for speed and turnAcc rate for turn rate.

      • setCourse

        public void setCourse(java.lang.String fname)
        Parameters:

      • drawRobotLocHeadingVel

        public void drawRobotLocHeadingVel(float x,
                                   float y)
        Draw text of robot location and heading into bitmap. Idea is user does not have direct access to this information. In the real world such data would not be easily obtainable without absolute position and orientation detection. Under certain circumstances this information might be made available

      • driveUpdate

        public void driveUpdate(boolean stepRequested)
        Called from draw() method, if stepRequseted simulator will calculate new position and heading of robot based on current speed and turn rate.

      • getContestTimeString

        public java.lang.String getContestTimeString()
        Current robot runtime formatted in minutes:seconds:milliseconds (stopwatch tick x timeStep)

      • setTimeStep

        public void setTimeStep(float dt)
        Set simulation time step, range 0.1 (10 steps per sec) to 0.01 (100 steps per sec) seconds. If the value of the argument exceeds the legal range, it will be restricted to the given bound. *
        Parameters:
        dt - time step in seconds, default value is 0.01667 (approximately 1/60th second) which corresponds to typical processing frame rate, resulting in robot that runs "the correct speed" when not throttling step rate as is available in the simulation.

      • setTargetSpeed

        public void setTargetSpeed(float s)
        Set target drive speed where the simulation will ramp up or ramp down using defined acceleration rate or deceleration rate to attain the target speed over succeeding simulation steps.
        Parameters:
        s - Target speed (inches/sec)

      • setTargetTurnRate

        public void setTargetTurnRate(float r)
        Set target drive speed where the simulation will ramp up or ramp down using defined acceleration rate or deceleration rate to attain the target speed over succeeding simulation steps.
        Parameters:
        r - Target turn rate (degrees/sec)

      • getSpeed

        public float getSpeed()
        Current robot speed, when less than targetSpeed robot is will be accelerating when greater than target speed, robot is decelerating
        Returns:
        speed (inches/sec)

      • getTurnRate

        public float getTurnRate()
        Current robot turn rate, when less than targetTurnRate robot is accelerating its turn rate when greater than target turn rate, robot is decelerating its turn rate.
        Returns:
        turn rate (degrees/sec)

      • createSpotSensor

        public SpotSensor createSpotSensor(float xoff,
                                   float yoff,
                                   int w,
                                   int h)
        This method is used to instantiate a new SpotSensor object. Defines the object instance and places it in a list referenced by LFS during the process of updating sensor data (via reading the screen pixels - after the robot view of the course has been rendered to a bitmap.
        Parameters:
        xoff - X offset (inches) from center of robot in robot coordinates.
        yoff - Y offset (inches) from center of robot in robot coordinates.
        w - width in pixels of spot sensor sampled area of "screen".
        h - height in pixels of spot sensor sampled area of "screen".
        Returns:
        Returns new instance of SpotSensor

      • createLineSensor

        public LineSensor createLineSensor(float xoff,
                                   float yoff,
                                   int w,
                                   int h,
                                   int numberOfSensors)
        This method to instantiate a new LineSensor object. Defines the object instance and places it in a list referenced by LFS during the process of updating sensor data (via reading the screen pixels - after the robot view of the course has been rendered to a bitmap.

        It should be noted the line sensor can be modified into a 1/2 circle sensor array and/or the sensor array can be rotated about the line sensor center spot.

        Parameters:
        xoff - X offset (inches) from center of robot in robot coordinates.
        yoff - Y offset (inches) from center of robot in robot coordinates.
        w - width in pixels of spot sensor sampled area of the screen.
        h - height in pixels of spot sensor sampled area of the screen.
        numberOfSensors - number of spots in line (will be incremented if even value specified)
        Returns:
        New instance of LineSensor

      • crumbsEraseAll

        public void crumbsEraseAll()
        Erase crumbs in course view - performed at start of robot run.

      • getRobotY

        Returns:
        Y (inches)

      • getRobotHeading

        public float getRobotHeading()
        If contest is not running return robot heading value (degrees). Example Headings given image with origin in upper-left corner +X axis running to right on "page" and +Y axis running down the "page" as you would view an image on a screen or paper on a desk. See illustration in User's Guide.

        0 = heading along image X axis in -X direction

        90 = heading along image Y axis in -Y direction

        180 = heading along image X axis in +X direction

        270 = heading along image Y axis in +Y direction

        Returns:
        Heading (degrees)

      • contestFinish

        public void contestFinish()
        Call after contest stopped (Key F - Finish) Logs run to .cdf file and initiates image save

      • contestScreenSaveIfRequested

        public void contestScreenSaveIfRequested()
        called at end of draw() to save processing window image after contestFinish() called
